Legal_Issue: Whether the Hearing Officer unreasonably concluded that the trademark was used during the relevant period
Procedural_Stage: Appeal under Section 45 of the Trademarks Act
Evidence_Assessment: Affidavit and evidence (photos, invoices) were vague; invoices lacked proof of trademark association with goods sold
Burden_of_Proof: On the trademark owner to demonstrate use within the three-year period
Credibility_Factor: Hearing Officer improperly accepted invoices as corroborative without verifying trademark linkage
Legal_Rule: Section 4(1): 'use' means marking the trademark on wares or packaging at time of transfer
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness standard applied by Federal Court
Procedural_Issue: Acceptance of insufficient evidence by Hearing Officer
Grounds_for_Claim: Non-use of trademark during the relevant period
Outcome_on_Merits: Appeal succeeds due to lack of reasonable evidence of use
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Hearing Officer's decision found unreasonable in evidentiary assessment
Court_Result: Trademark expunged; respondents ordered to pay costs
Legal_Rule_Source: Section 4(1) and Section 56 of the Trademarks Act
Resolution_Mechanism: Administrative hearing followed by judicial review
Legal_Provision: Section 4(1), Section 45, Section 56 of the Trademarks Act
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to provide sufficient evidence of trademark use
Applicable_Process: Section 45 non-use proceeding and appeal under Section 56
Governing_Rule: Section 4(1) definition of 'use' and Section 56 standard for appeal
